AI Governance Framework & Controls

This document outlines a comprehensive framework for governing Artificial Intelligence (AI) systems, drawing upon multiple standards and regulatory considerations. It focuses on establishing robust controls across various domains to ensure responsible AI development and deployment. The framework is built around a set of Master Controls categorized under several key areas, including Executive Commitment & Accountability (GL-1), Roles & Responsibilities (GL-2), Strategic Alignment (GL-3), and Risk Management (RM-1 through RM-4). Furthermore, it incorporates elements of regulatory compliance (RO-1 through RO-4), data governance (LC-1 through LC-5), security governance (SE-1 through SE-6), human oversight (RS-1 through RS-5), and privacy considerations (PR-1 through PR-4). The document emphasizes a layered approach, combining internal assessments and audits (AA-1, AA-2, AA-3) with independent certification to validate safety and security. System performance monitoring (OM-1) is also included. The core purpose is to provide a practical, real-world framework for organizations to manage the risks and complexities associated with AI, aligning with standards like SOC2, ISO27701, NIST RMF, ISO42001, and ISO27001EU. The document suggests a proactive approach to AI governance, prioritizing ethical considerations, data quality, security, and regulatory adherence. It‚Äôs designed to be a starting point for organizations seeking to establish a formalized AI governance program. The framework‚Äôs modular structure allows for customization based on specific organizational needs and risk profiles. The document‚Äôs focus on explainability, fairness, and bias management reflects the growing importance of these aspects in responsible AI development. The inclusion of multiple control sources indicates a desire to integrate best practices from diverse domains.
